top_categories.workout_context: At 100 miles, Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race’s michigan farmland, rolling gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race’s michigan rolling farmland gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race’s michigan rolling farmland gravel delivers on race day.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
At 100 miles, Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Every session at Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on michigan rolling farmland gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on michigan rolling farmland gravel to build confidence. Expect: michigan farmland, rolling gravel, 100+ mile distance.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of michigan rolling farmland gravel in Hastings, Michigan.
